stories.name: Priya Sharma
stories.journey: Started as a curious student in rural Maharashtra, struggled with limited resources but never gave up. Self-taught programming through online courses, built 15+ projects, and landed her dream job at Google after 3 years of persistence.
stories.inspiration: "Every line of code I wrote brought me closer to my dreams. The journey wasn't easy, but it was worth every struggle."

stories.name: Dr. Arjun Patel
stories.journey: Son of a farmer who dreamed of saving lives. Studied under streetlights, worked part-time jobs to fund his education, and became one of India's youngest cardiac surgeons at 28.
stories.inspiration: "Medicine chose me when I saw my grandfather struggle without proper healthcare. Every life I save honors his memory."

stories.name: Kavya Menon
stories.journey: Fought family pressure to pursue 'practical' careers. Started selling art on Instagram, built a following of 100K+, and now owns three art galleries across India while mentoring young artists.
keyMilestones: Fine Arts degree from JJ School of Art
stories.inspiration: "Art isn't just my profession, it's my language. Through colors and canvas, I speak to souls across the world."

stories.name: Rohit Kumar
stories.journey: Started with a small tea stall business during college. Identified the gap in sustainable technology, bootstrapped his startup with ₹50,000, and built a ₹100 crore company in 5 years.
stories.inspiration: "Every problem is an opportunity in disguise. Sustainability isn't just business for me, it's our responsibility to the planet."

stories.name: Ananya Singh
stories.journey: Transformed a failing government school in Rajasthan into a model institution. Her innovative teaching methods increased student enrollment by 300% and achievement scores by 250%.
stories.inspiration: "Education is the most powerful weapon to change the world. Every child deserves a chance to dream and achieve."

stories.name: Vikram Reddy
stories.journey: Fascinated by space since childhood, built rockets from scrap materials. Despite financial constraints, earned a PhD in Aerospace Engineering and now leads India's Mars mission projects.
stories.inspiration: "The sky is not the limit when there are footprints on the moon. Every calculation brings us closer to the stars."

stories.name: Meera Joshi
stories.currentRole: Investment Banking Director at Goldman Sachs
stories.journey: Broke gender stereotypes in finance. Started as a junior analyst, worked 80-hour weeks, mastered complex financial models, and became the youngest female director in her division.
stories.inspiration: "Numbers don't lie, and neither do results. In finance, your work speaks louder than any bias or stereotype."

stories.name: Karan Malhotra
stories.journey: Former national-level athlete who couldn't make it to Olympics due to injury. Channeled his passion into coaching and has trained 12 Olympic medalists in the last decade.
stories.inspiration: "My injury ended my Olympic dream, but it birthed the dreams of dozens of others. Success is about lifting others up."
